DataElement.preferredName: Medical Record Colorectal Carcinoma Screening Evaluation Past Year Patient Completed Follow-up Recommendation Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Recommedation for follow-up activities given to a patient who had an abnormal result from a diagnostic screening test for colorectal carcinoma . [Manually-curated].

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medical Record Colorectal Carcinoma Screening Evaluation Past Year Patient Completed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Text name of the diagnostic screening test for colorectal carcinoma completed by a patient. [Manually-curated]

ObjectClass.preferredName: Medical Record Colorectal Carcinoma Screening Evaluation
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A chronological written account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes the patient's medical history and complaints, the physician's physical findings, the results of diagnostic tests and procedures, and medications and therapeutic procedures. (dictionary.com):Grossly, most colorectal carcinomas are either polypoid or of the ulcerative -infiltrating type.  Adenocarcinoma is the most common carcinoma in the colon and rectum.  Colorectal adenocarcinoma can be divided in three grades: Grade I (low grade or well-di:Checking for disease when there are no symptoms.:Evaluation; the act of placing value on something.

Concepts.definition: A chronological written account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes the patient's medical history and complaints, the physician's physical findings, the results of diagnostic tests and procedures, and medications and therapeutic procedures.
A malignant epithelial neoplasm that arises from the colon or rectum and invades through the muscularis mucosa into the submucosa.  The vast majority are adenocarcinomas.
The use of any device, marker, or other means for the purpose of detecting the presence of disease, usually in asymptomatic individuals.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Property.preferredDefinition: Past; before the present time.:The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.:A person who requires medical care.:Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A method of examination, as to determine the presence or absence of a definite disease or of some substance in any of the fluids, tissues, or excretions of the body, or to determine the presence or degree of a psychological or behavioral trait. Concepts.definition: A method of examination, as to determine the presence or absence of a definite disease or of some substance in any of the fluids, tissues, or excretions of the body, or to determine the presence or degree of a psychological or behavioral trait. (from STED26)

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
